snippet: Deep budget cuts have Philadelphia school officials worrying about how to make do without aides, secretaries, counselors, monitors, coaches or money for new books or paper.
abstract: Deep budget cuts have Philadelphia school officials worrying about how to make do without aides, secretaries, counselors, monitors, coaches or money for new books or paper; 19 percent of city's school-based work force has been laid off, and supplementary funding has not been forthcoming, creating worst educational crisis for city in recent memory.
lead_paragraph: Deep budget cuts have Philadelphia school officials worrying about how to make do without aides, secretaries, counselors, monitors, coaches or money for new books or paper.

headline.main: Budget Cuts Reach Bone for Philadelphia Schools
headline.print_headline: Budget Cuts Reach Bone For Philadelphia Schools
